working_definition: Orthopedic Impairment refers to a severe orthopedic condition that adversely affects a child’s educational performance. The term includes impairments caused by congenital anomaly, disease (e.g., bone tuberculosis), and other causes (e.g., cerebral palsy, amputations, or fractures that cause contractures).

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Cerebral Palsy
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: A neurological disorder that affects movement and muscle tone, often resulting in limited mobility and coordination.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Spina Bifida
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: A congenital defect of the spine that can cause partial or full paralysis and bladder/bowel control issues.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Muscular Dystrophy
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: A group of genetic diseases that cause progressive weakness and loss of muscle mass.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Juvenile Arthritis
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: An autoimmune disease causing pain and swelling in joints, which can limit movement and stamina.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Amputation or Limb Deficiency
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: Loss of a limb or part of a limb, congenital or acquired, that affects mobility or fine motor tasks.
